title: Speeding Creta SUV Kills Boy, 4, In Mumbai, Teen Driver Arrested - NDTV
25 Notable Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 On Bail & Arrest - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
25 Notable Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 On Bail & Arrest

Publication Date: 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court delivered several notable judgments in 2024 regarding bail and arrest powers, emphasizing personal liberty and the right to a speedy trial amidst lengthy incarcerations.

  • Judgment 1: UAPA – Mere Delay In Trial No Ground For Bail When Grave Offences Are Involved.
  • Judgment 2: Verdict In 'KA Najeeb' Upholding Right Of UAPA Accused For Bail On Ground Of Delay In Trial.
  • Judgment 3: Illegal Arrest and Remand Cannot Be Validated By Filing of Chargesheet.
  • Judgment 4: ED Cannot Arrest Accused After Special Court Has Taken Cognizance Of PMLA Complaint.
  • Judgment 5: Bail Cannot Be Denied Based On Expedited Trial.
  • Further judgments emphasized that 'bail is the rule, jail is the exception' even in special laws and highlighted procedural proprieties that need to be observed by judicial authorities.

“Bail is the rule, jail the exception.” – Supreme Court

This year's judgments signify a pivotal shift in ensuring the protection of individual rights and liberties in the context of criminal law and justice.
newTitle: 25 Notable Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 On Bail & Arrest

summary:

A devastating building collapse in Mohali has resulted in the death toll reaching two, as search and rescue operations continue.

  • The initial collapse occurred early in the morning, with emergency services responding promptly.
  • Rescue teams have managed to recover one body from the debris, with another individual reported missing.
  • Local authorities are investigating the cause of the collapse.
“Search efforts are ongoing, and we hope to find the missing person soon,” said a local official.

As rescue operations proceed, the community grapples with the loss and seeks answers regarding the structural integrity of the building.

title: India can never permit others to have a veto on its choices: EAM Jaishankar - The Hindu
summary:
EAM Jaishankar: India Will Not Permit Others to Veto Its Choices

Date: December 22, 2024 Source: The Hindu

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar reaffirmed that India will not allow external entities to dictate its choices. Speaking in a video message, he stressed the importance of India's cultural heritage and its role in a globalized world.

  • Jaishankar emphasized that India must advance while preserving its cultural identity.
  • He acknowledged the significant influence of India on the global stage.
  • The awards Jaishankar received highlight public and community leadership with a focus on spiritualism.
  • He pointed out the disconnect many have felt between modernization and tradition.
  • Jaishankar called for a deeper appreciation of India's heritage among its youth.
“Independence should never be confused with neutrality. We will do whatever is right in our national interest and for global good without being intimidated to conform.” — Dr. S. Jaishankar

Jaishankar's remarks come as India stands at a significant crossroads in its development and international relations, balancing heritage with modernity.
newTitle: EAM Jaishankar: India Will Not Permit Others to Veto Its Choices

title: Mohali building collapse: NDRF, Army continue rescue operation on day 2 - The Tribune India
summary:
Mohali Building Collapse: Rescue Operation Continues on Day 2

Published on: [Date] - Source: The Tribune

Rescue operations continued on the second day at the site of a collapsed building in Mohali, with the death toll rising to two. A man, identified as Abhishek Dhanwal of Ambala, was pulled out from the debris. Locals reported that he had entered the building to retrieve his phone despite warnings.

  1. Two people have died due to the building collapse.
  2. Five people were trapped under the debris.
  3. Rescue operations are ongoing with NDRF and Army personnel involved.
  4. Police have booked the two building owners.
The deceased, Abhishek Dhanwal, had rushed into the building to retrieve his phone and was subsequently buried under the debris.

Investigations are underway to determine the cause of the building collapse, which occurred due to digging work in an adjacent building's basement.
newTitle: Mohali Building Collapse: Rescue Operation Continues on Day 2

title: BJP makes gains in municipal polls, surprises with wins in semi-rural areas - The Indian Express
summary:
BJP Makes Gains in Municipal Polls, Surprises in Semi-Rural Areas

Publication Date: July 6, 2024   Source: Indian Express

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has made significant strides in Punjab’s municipal elections, securing notable victories across multiple municipalities and councils, indicating a growing influence in urban and semi-rural areas.

  • BJP won several wards in Ludhiana, Jalandhar, Amritsar, Phagwara, and Patiala.
  • Poonam Ratra defeated AAP MLA's wife, Meenu Prashar, in Ludhiana by 574 votes.
  • BJP claimed 18 wins out of 90 wards contested in Ludhiana.
  • In Phagwara, Congress led with 20 victories, while AAP won only 13.
  • Independents won major seats in Mansa and Shahkot, with AAP and BJP trailing behind.
  • Notable wins by BJP in semi-urban areas, surprising local political dynamics.
“The results indicate BJP’s growing influence in urban and semi-rural Punjab, even as AAP and SAD grapple with mixed performances.”

The significant wins for BJP in these elections suggest a shift in voter sentiment and the potential for future political strategies in Punjab.
newTitle: BJP Makes Gains in Municipal Polls, Surprises in Semi-Rural Areas

title: Delhi air pollution: AQI back to ‘severe’ as cold wave continues to grip national capital | Updates - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi air pollution: AQI back to ‘severe’ as cold wave continues to grip national capital

Date: Dec 22, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The air quality index (AQI) in Delhi has deteriorated back to the ‘severe’ category with a recorded AQI of 427, coinciding with a cold wave affecting the national capital.

  • Delhi’s AQI has dropped to 'severe' levels, significantly impacting health.
  • Minimum temperature recorded at 8 degrees Celsius on Sunday.
  • Cold wave has led to an increase in smog conditions in the city.
  • Health experts recommend staying indoors, particularly for vulnerable groups.
  • The 24-hour average on Saturday was 370, categorized as 'very poor'.
  • Air quality has become the worst since December 2021.
"People without roofs were seen taking shelter at camps and tents arranged for them in Delhi during the winter season."

This latest spike in pollution levels has raised concerns among health authorities and led to recommendations for minimizing outdoor activities.
newTitle: Delhi Air Pollution Hits Severe Levels Amid Cold Wave

title: CLAT 2025: Delhi High Court finds errors in 2 questions; orders NLU Consortium to revise the results - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi High Court Orders Revision of CLAT 2025 Results Due to Question Errors

Date: Recent Source: Not specified

In a significant ruling, the Delhi High Court has found errors in two questions of the CLAT 2025 exam and ordered the National Law University (NLU) Consortium to revise the results. The Court emphasized that the corrections must benefit all candidates who selected the correct option as determined by the Court and the Expert Committee.

  • The Court directed the Consortium to extend the benefit to all candidates who selected option ‘C’ for question 14.
  • Question 100 was deemed erroneous and will be excluded from the evaluation.
  • The case was brought forth by a 17-year-old candidate, Aditya Singh, who claimed that his admission prospects were compromised due to the incorrect answer key.
  • Singh had submitted objections prior to the final answer key release, but claimed the Consortium failed to address them.
  • The Court highlighted the need for justice in cases of demonstrable errors in exam questions.
“Since Court has upheld option ‘C’ as the correct answer...benefit cannot be restricted only to the petitioner and will extend to all candidates who have opted for option ‘C’,”
“Question number 100 will be excluded...the result will be accordingly revised,”

In conclusion, this ruling underscores the importance of accuracy in examination processes and the duty of educational bodies to address grievances appropriately.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Orders Revision of CLAT 2025 Results Due to Question Errors

title: Thick Smog Blankets Delhi, Mumbai As Air Quality Dips - NDTV
summary:
Thick Smog Blankets Delhi, Mumbai As Air Quality Dips

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Delhi and Mumbai are experiencing severe air quality issues exacerbated by cold wave conditions, with Delhi's Air Quality Index (AQI) hitting 386 and Mumbai at 176.

  • Delhi's AQI is in the 'very poor' category, leading to the re-imposition of the Graded Response Action Plan.
  • Schools in Delhi have shifted to online modes, and construction activities are halted.
  • There are advisories for low visibility at Delhi Airport due to the poor air quality.
  • Mumbai is also facing its coldest winters with an AQI that has touched 199 in the 'poor' category.
“Update issued at 07:20 hours. Kind attention to all flyers! #Fog #FogAlert #DelhiAirport” — Delhi Airport

The smog may persist for several days due to intensifying cold wave conditions.
newTitle: Thick Smog Blankets Delhi and Mumbai as Air Quality Dips

Delhi and Mumbai are experiencing a significant drop in air quality, with Delhi's Air Quality Index (AQI) at 386, categorized as 'very poor'. Meanwhile, Mumbai's AQI is at 176, categorized as 'moderate'. Cold wave conditions are exacerbating the smog.

  • Delhi's AQI has been at 'very poor' for two consecutive days.
  • The Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) has been re-imposed in Delhi, affecting schools and vehicle regulations.
  • Mumbai experiences its coldest winter in decades, contributing to air quality issues.
  • Social media shows citizens documenting worsening air conditions.
“Low visibility procedures are in progress at Delhi Airport. Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information.” — Delhi Airport

The persistent smog and declining air quality in both cities are raising concerns about public health and safety.

title: Himachal Woman, 20, Dies In Mohali Building Collapse, Several Still Trapped - NDTV
summary:
Himachal Woman, 20, Dies In Mohali Building Collapse, Several Still Trapped

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: New Delhi

A multi-agency rescue effort is underway after a four-storey building collapsed in Mohali, Punjab, resulting in the death of a 20-year-old woman identified as Drishti Verma from Himachal Pradesh.

  • Drishti was rescued from the rubble in critical condition but succumbed to her injuries.
  • At least five individuals are reported to be trapped in the debris.
  • Rescue teams from the Indian Army and the National Disaster Response Team (NDRF) are involved in operations.
  • The building reportedly collapsed due to excavation work on an adjacent plot.
  • Police have filed a case against the building owners for culpable homicide.
  • Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is monitoring the rescue efforts.
“Sad news has been received that a multistorey building near Sohana in Sahibzada Ajit Singh Nagar (Mohali) has collapsed... We pray that there is no loss of life, we will also take action against the culprits.” - Bhagwant Mann

Officials have released a helpline number for assistance: 0172-2219506.
newTitle: Himachal Woman Dies in Mohali Building Collapse, Rescue Efforts Ongoing

title: GST Council hikes tax on used, old EV cars by businesses; Opposition reacts - Hindustan Times
summary:
GST Council hikes tax on used, old EV cars by businesses; Opposition reacts

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, has approved an increase of the tax rate on used electric vehicles sold by businesses from 12% to 18%. This decision aims to align used EV tax rates with those of non-electric vehicles.

  • The tax applies only to the margin value of sales by businesses.
  • Individual sellers remain exempt from this tax.
  • The decision faced criticism from opposition leaders, asserting it's unfavorable to the middle class.
  • Arvind Kejriwal criticized the move, stating it damages the aspirations of middle-class families.
  • Akhilesh Yadav accused the government of creating an uncertain business environment with frequent GST changes.
“Purchasing a car is a big deal for an ordinary middle-class family, but the central government is crushing their dreams...” - Arvind Kejriwal

The GST Council's decision reflects a broader strategy to regulate the used electric vehicle market in India, impacting businesses significantly while continuing to shield individual transactions.
newTitle: GST Council Increases Tax on Used Electric Vehicles; Opposition Responds

summary:

Prime Minister Narendra Modi held an emotional meeting with 101-year-old IFS officer Mangal Sain Handa in Kuwait, after a request from Handa's family. The interaction was warmly received by the family and showcased the Prime Minister's engagement with the Indian diaspora.

  • Mangal Sain Handa served in various countries throughout his career, including Iraq, Kuwait, and China.
  • His granddaughter expressed gratitude to PM Modi for accommodating the meeting on social media.
  • The event highlighted Modi's connection with the common people through social media interactions.
  • Handa's family expressed deep appreciation for the Prime Minister's gesture.
“You’ve won our hearts once again…Mangal Sain Handa is overjoyed, and his smile means the world to us.” - Shreya Juneja

This encounter reflects PM Modi's ongoing effort to connect with people at a personal level while utilizing social media effectively.

title: Hindu right body puts up posters of Rahul Gandhi in Raebareli over Parliament scuffle - Deccan Herald
summary:
Hindu Rights Body Criticizes Rahul Gandhi with Posters in Raebareli

Published on: 21 December 2024, Source: Local News

A Hindu rights organization has displayed posters of Rahul Gandhi in Raebareli, condemning his actions during a recent scuffle in Parliament.

  • The Vishwa Hindu Raksha Parishad has put up hoardings from the Churuva border to Raebareli district headquarters.
  • Rahul Singh, national general secretary, expressed his discontent over the treatment of an elderly MP during the Parliament incident.
  • Congress leaders, including district president Pankaj Tiwari, rebuffed accusations of violence against Gandhi, attributing them to political frustration.
  • Gandhi faced police action for his involvement in a Parliament scuffle that resulted in injuries to BJP MPs.
“Rahul Gandhi connected many people during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. This has been done only out of frustration and the people of the district know everything.” - Pankaj Tiwari

The incident highlights ongoing political tensions and the polarizing nature of contemporary Indian politics, with both parties seeking to leverage public sentiment.

title: Video: Car Flips 8 Times But Five Passengers Come Out Unscathed. Their Priority? Tea - News18
summary:
Video: Car Flips 8 Times But Five Passengers Come Out Unscathed. Their Priority? Tea

Date: December 21, 2024, Source: News18

Five passengers were unhurt after their car flipped eight times in an accident on a highway in Rajasthan’s Nagaur. The accident was captured on CCTV which showed the car speeding on the highway.

  • The driver lost control while taking a turn, causing the vehicle to flip eight times.
  • In a miraculous escape, none of the five passengers sustained injuries.
  • After the accident, passengers entered a nearby car showroom and asked for tea.
“No one was hurt…not even a single scratch. As soon as they entered, they asked for tea.”

This incident underscores the unpredictability of road safety yet highlights a fortunate outcome for the passengers.

title: Fadnavis retains Home, Ajit Finance, Shinde gets Urban, Works, and Housing - The Indian Express
summary:
Fadnavis Retains Home, Ajit Finance, Shinde Gets Urban, Works, and Housing

Publication Date: December 16, 2023

Source: Indian Express

In a recent cabinet reshuffle, Maharashtra's BJP-led government announced the allocation of ministerial portfolios, retaining significant positions amidst the recent elections.

  • Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis retains the Home Ministry and key departments such as Energy and Law & Judiciary.
  • Deputy CM Eknath Shinde receives Urban Development, Housing, and Public Works.
  • NCP Chief Ajit Pawar is allocated Finance & Planning along with State Excise.
  • The cabinet includes a total of 42 ministers following the induction of 39 new ministers on December 15, 2023.
“The portfolio allocation aims to ensure ministerial accountability after a strong electoral mandate.”

The reshuffle reflects a strategy to maintain effective governance while allowing opportunities for other party members in the future.
newTitle: Fadnavis Retains Key Portfolios Amidst Maharashtra Cabinet Reshuffle

The recent allocation of portfolios in Maharashtra sees Devendra Fadnavis retaining the important home ministry, while Ajit Pawar takes over the finance department. Eknath Shinde has been assigned urban development, and the housing portfolio is also a crucial part of the new allocations.

  • Ajit Pawar has been given the finance portfolio.

title: Punjab civic polls: AAP wins in Patiala, leads in Jalandhar, Ludhiana; Congress ahead in Amritsar, Phagwara - The Hindu
summary:
Punjab civic polls: AAP wins in Patiala, leads in Jalandhar, Ludhiana; Congress ahead in Amritsar, Phagwara

Published: December 22, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) emerged victorious in the Punjab municipal elections, winning Patiala and leading in Ludhiana and Jalandhar, while the Congress party held an advantage in Amritsar and Phagwara.

  • AAP won 43 out of 53 wards in Patiala and is set to elect its mayor.
  • In Ludhiana, AAP secured 42 out of 95 wards, while Congress won 29 wards.
  • AAP led in Jalandhar with 39 out of 85 wards, compared to Congress's 24 and BJP's 19.
  • Congress claimed 40 wards in Amritsar, leaving AAP with 28.
  • In Phagwara, Congress won 22 wards, emerging as the largest party.
  • AAP President Aman Arora claimed historic success, noting a win in over 50% of the 977 contested wards.
“This resounding victory is a testament to AAP's pro-people governance and commitment to transparent politics,” said AAP President Aman Arora.

The elections took place amid allegations of fake votes and opposition claims of electoral misconduct.
newTitle: AAP Wins Punjab Municipal Elections; Congress Leads in Key Areas

summary:

  • A sleeper cell operated in Assam, West Bengal, and Kerala.
  • The mastermind, Sad Radi, has connections with the Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT).
  • The Siliguri Corridor is deemed a strategic target for terrorist activities.
  • Arrests occurred after meetings in Jalpaiguri and Falakata.
  • A 16 GB pen drive and suspicious documents were recovered from the suspects.
“This is a very well-coordinated operation and we are in touch with Assam police.” - IG STF Gaurav Sharma

The investigation highlights significant security concerns in light of geopolitical tensions and the strategic importance of the Siliguri Corridor.

Delayed Exams, Holiday: Students Behind Bomb Threats To 3 Delhi Schools, Say Cops - NDTV
summary:
Students Behind Bomb Threats to Three Delhi Schools, Police Say

Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

The Delhi Police have identified that bomb threats sent to three schools were orchestrated by the students themselves, who sought to postpone exams. The police have conducted counseling and warned the parents of the involved students.

  • Three Delhi schools received bomb threat emails linked to their own students.
  • The students sent the emails to postpone exams after a recent explosion in Rohini.
  • The police declared the threats as hoaxes after investigations.
  • Over 100 bomb threats have targeted Delhi schools in the past 11 days.
“The emails were sent through a VPN, making it difficult to trace the perpetrators.”

This situation highlights a concerning trend of students resorting to bomb threats as a means of manipulating school schedules.
newTitle: Students Behind Bomb Threats to Three Delhi Schools, Police Say
